intro: Botrychium virginianum f. gracile, commonly known as the slender moonwort, is a fern-like plant belonging to the family Onocleaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped fronds that are typically smaller and more delicate than those of the typical species. The plant exhibits a unique reproductive structure called a sorus, which contains the spore-producing organs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas with rich, organic soil. This fern-like plant is a fascinating example of the diverse morphology found within the Botrychium genus.
